final_answer:
The humor in the image arises from the contrast and visual comparison between two figures. The "silhouette_figure" on the left showcases an idealized, stylish appearance with tattoo-covered arms, suggesting a cool, artistic look. This is contrasted by the "comic_figure" on the right, whose hairy arms mimic tattoo patterns, but are in reality just natural arm hair.

The comedic effect is heightened by the expectation of sophisticated tattoos versus the mundane reality of hairy arms. The words "YES, BUT" also play into the humor by setting up an expectation and then humorously subverting it. This juxtaposition highlights the disparity between appearance and reality, making it satirical and funny.
